abstract: There are two big books sitting on my desk, and if I was the kind of editor I dream of being, I'd have read them both already.
snippet: There are two big books sitting on my desk, and if I was the kind of editor I dream of being, I'd have read them both already.
lead_paragraph: There are two big books sitting on my desk, and if I were the kind of editor I dream of being, I'd have read them both already. As it is, I can only claim to have read the shorter of the two volumes, Daniel Kahneman's "Thinking Fast and Slow," which is only 418 pages (not including appendices and index), a twee little thing compared to Haruki Murakami's 925-page beast "1Q84."

headline.main: This Sunday: Doorstops! Doorstops! Get Your Doorstops Here!
